title: Extreme Packet Loss

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
So, just played this game with insane amounts of packet loss and lag. Everyone on my team had the same packet loss and lag.
They're all people I've never played with before, and it's not a LAN party situation. So we're not sharing the same network/internet.

All of my browser pages load fine, and there's 0 lag issues with any other game, as confirmed by one of my team mates too. (Like Overwatch and Rocket League are running fine).

So one of the servers must be acting weird?

Would love feedback.

replies.body:
I looked into your match and everyone was able to finish the match, which is good.  If everyone was truly impacted by delays, then something like an ISP or some server hiccup could have been the culprit.  

I don't see anything odd going on right now, but I'll keep an eye out just in case.  Thanks for the heads up!

Same problem here last few days ping is hopping all over the place.  I'm in chicago and use AT&T (i know it sucks but....) a few weeks ago i had the same issue and it turned out to be an AT&T issue.  Hopefully it gets resolved so i can go back to being terrible on the rift.
It turns out to be a Charter issue this time around. But same idea, yeah.
Are you on the west coast? I too am having these issues consistently. I've tried the hextech repair tool and submitted a ticket this morning .

Yeah, I'm on the West Coast, Nevada at least. 
I'm just hoping they acknowledge and fix it soon.
I've been having frame drop issues for the last month, and now this.
Oh that's funny. I'm in the Washoe county area. Maybe it's a thing with Charter and League specifically?

Dude, I'm in Washoe county too. Reno reppin. 
It could be. I've had no issues with my internet otherwise.
